Dear Jeana Koerber:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff uses blocking pads to push a recipient into their room.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Consultant completed SIR #2024SIC0001218 (dated 4/17/24)
which had an identical allegation, but no findings. The complaint
source was anonymous, so no details regarding staff involved,
location, date, or time were known, and staff interviewed did not
provide any information. However, on 6/14/24, Chief Administrator
provided additional details found in the Office of Recipient Right’s
(ORR) report, which identified Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 as
having additional details.
Youth A is non-verbal and could not be interviewed.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via phone on
5/15/24, and face to face at the facility on 5/17/24. CA reported
the ORR’s report identified Supervisor as the person who pushed
Youth A with the blocking pad on or about 1/31/24. CA reported
Supervisor was on suspension pending the investigation, and
Supervisor accused Staff 5 of making up this allegation as a form
of retaliation.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/17/24.
Staff 1 reported in December 2023/January 2024 (didn’t know
exactly when), Youth A was in his room and began escalating.
Staff 1 reported she was working with Supervisor and another
staff but couldn’t remember who. Staff 1 reported she was in the
kitchen and saw Youth A trying to come out of his room. Staff 1
reported Supervisor grabbed a blocking pad and looked like
Supervisor was using the blocking pad to keep Youth A from
coming out of his room. Staff 1 reported she couldn’t see if Youth
A was being aggressive towards Supervisor or not. Staff 1
2

reported Supervisor used the blocking pad in a forward motion
towards Youth A. Staff 1 reported she talked to Staff 2 sometime
after the incident occurred, and Staff 2 confirmed Supervisor was
wrong, and it shouldn’t have happened. Staff 1 reported Staff 2
mentioned she saw Supervisor use a blocking pad to push Youth
A another time.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/21/24.
Staff 2 reported one night at the end of January 2024, she came in
for third shift at the end of an incident occurring. Staff 2 reported
Youth A was in the dining room, and it appeared he was trying to
communicate something. Staff 2 reported Supervisor, Staff 4, and
Staff 5 were sitting on the floor in the kitchen. Staff 2 reported it
was bedtime, and they were all telling Youth A to go to bed. Staff
2 reported Staff 5 called Program Manager (PM) for feedback, and
PM said to ignore Youth A and he would go to bed. Staff 2
reported she, Staff 4, and Staff 5 all proceeded to ignore Youth A,
but Supervisor didn’t. Staff 2 reported instead of ignoring Youth A,
Supervisor yelled at him, and used the blocking pad to push him
towards his room. Staff 2 reported Supervisor was persistent in
getting Youth A to his room, and it was a long battle, which got out
of hand. Staff 2 reported Youth A eventually went into his room
and went to sleep.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 5/15/24. A follow-up
phone interview was attempted on 5/29/24, but Staff 3 never
returned contact. Staff 3 reported sometime in January 2024,
she was working in the morning with Supervisor, but couldn’t
recall who else was working with them. Staff 3 reported Youth A
was mad because he was hungry, so he tried to get in the kitchen.
Staff 3 reported when Youth A couldn’t get in the kitchen, he ran
around the dining room, picked up chairs, and threw them. Staff 3
reported when Youth A was running, Supervisor picked up a
blocking pad, and tried to stop him. Staff 3 reported Supervisor
used the blocking pad to push Youth A into the bathroom.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 5/29/24. Staff 4 reported
on 1/29/24, it was bedtime and she, Supervisor, and Staff 5 were
trying to get Youth A to bed. Staff 4 reported Youth A didn’t want
to go to bed, so he became escalated when he was prompted.
Youth A began throwing things, so Staff 5 called PM. Staff 4
reported PM directed them not to give Youth A any attention, and
he would eventually go to bed. Staff 4 reported they turned off the
lights and sat in the kitchen so Youth A wouldn’t think anything
was going on and would hopefully calm down. Staff 4 reported
Youth A eventually went to his bedroom and went to sleep. Staff 4
3

reported she didn’t remember Staff 5 or Supervisor every holding
a blocking pad that night. Staff 4 reported she has never seen
anyone, including Supervisor, push Youth A using a blocking pad.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on 5/23/24. Staff 5 reported
one night (couldn’t remember when), Youth A was escalated
around bedtime. Staff 5 reported she was working with Staff 4 and
Supervisor, but Staff 2 also came in for her shift near the end of
the incident. Staff 5 reported since Youth A was escalated, she
and Supervisor retreated to the kitchen to create space. Staff 5
reported the other youth were in their bedrooms or in the living
room, and Staff 4 remained in the living room. Staff 5 reported she
was going between the kitchen and the living room. Staff 5
reported when she was in the kitchen, she picked up a blocking
pad and held it against the door handle of the half-door in the
kitchen so Youth A could not enter the kitchen. After Youth A
began throwing objects at them in the kitchen, Staff 5 reported she
called PM for advice, and asked if he could come back to the
facility because he had recently left. Staff 5 reported PM told them
to keep their distance and wait it out. Staff 5 reported Supervisor
picked up the other blocking pad and left the kitchen. Staff 5
reported Supervisor was holding up the blocking pad to block the
items Youth A was throwing at her. Staff 5 reported she never saw
Supervisor use the blocking pad to push Youth A into his room,
but admitted she wasn’t watching the entire time since she was
going back and forth between the kitchen and living room. Staff 5
reported at one point, Youth A entered his room, and Supervisor
shut his bedroom door quickly, but Youth A came right back out of
his room. Staff 5 reported she, Supervisor and Staff 2 went back
into the kitchen, turned the lights off, and stopped talking in hopes
Youth A would calm down. Staff 5 reported Youth A eventually
calmed down, went to his room, and went to sleep.
Supervisor was interviewed via phone on 5/29/24. Supervisor
reported on 1/29/24, she was working with Staff 2, Staff 4, and
Staff 5. Supervisor reported Staff 2 was just coming in for third
shift, so Supervisor couldn’t remember how much of the incident
Staff 2 witnessed. Supervisor reported it was bedtime and Youth A
became escalated because he received a warning it was bedtime,
and he was upset he couldn’t use his iPad anymore. Youth A was
in the dining room and began throwing objects and chairs
towards/into the kitchen. Supervisor reported all the other youth
were in their bedrooms with their doors shut. Supervisor reported
Staff 5 was holding a blocking pad in front of her while she was
attempting to de-escalate Youth A. Supervisor reported Youth A
charged at Staff 5, grabbed onto her hair, and pulled some of Staff
4

5’s hair out before Staff 5 got away. Supervisor reported she
prompted Staff 5 to go into the kitchen, which is where Supervisor,
Staff 2, Staff 4, and Staff 5 all stayed. After about 20 minutes,
Staff 5 suggested calling PM, but Supervisor couldn’t remember
who talked to PM. Supervisor reported PM suggested getting rid
of the items Youth A was interested in and eliminating any
attention towards Youth A. Supervisor reported she turned off the
kitchen lights because the iPad was in the kitchen, and she
wanted it to be out of sight. Supervisor reported after 10-15
minutes, Youth A went to his bedroom. Supervisor reported after
about 5 minutes, she went to check on Youth A, and Youth A
wasn’t asleep, but he was calm. Supervisor reported Youth A
stayed in his room and eventually fell asleep. Supervisor reported
she never picked up or used a blocking pad that evening.
Supervisor reported she has never used a blocking pad with
Youth A or any other youth. Supervisor reported if a youth is being
aggressive, she keeps her distance. Supervisor reported she
doesn’t like to use physical management with any youth.
Supervisor reported she believes blocking pads can be too
physical and might escalate a youth more because they might be
afraid. Supervisor reported the only time she has seen Youth A
escalated was the night of 1/29/24. Supervisor reported she has
never been in a situation where she used a blocking pad to push
Youth A to keep him in his room, or where she used a blocking
pad to push Youth A into the bathroom because he was
escalated. Supervisor reported she’s very upset and hurt by all the
false allegations being made against her because working with
this population is her passion and lifelong career.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• SIR #2024SIC0001218 (dated 4/17/24) had an identical
allegation, but no findings. Supervisor, Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff
3, and Staff 4 were not interviewed as part of the
investigation. Staff 5 was interviewed as part of the
investigation (identified as Student 2) and stated she had
never seen or heard of any staff using a blocking pad to
push Youth A into his room.
• Youth A case file: Youth A was admitted on 1/23/24.
• Staff Schedule 1/23/24-2/4/24 identifies Staff 4, Staff 5, and
Supervisor worked second shift and Staff 2 worked third
shift on 1/29/24. Staff 3 also worked third shift on 1/29/24
but came in after second shift staff left.
5

• Office of Recipient Rights (ORR) Report of Investigative
Findings outlines the interviews completed during the ORR
investigation. ORR substantiated Supervisor for the
allegation of Abuse II – Unreasonable Force.
o The ORR report focuses on 1/31/24 being the date
of the incident; however, the date identified is not
consistent with interviews regarding who was
working when the incident occurred.
o Staff 1’s interview during this investigation is
consistent her interview in the ORR report. It notes
Staff 1 was concerned about retaliation from
Supervisor.
o Staff 2’s interview during this investigation was
consistent with her interview in the ORR report.
o Staff 3’s interview in the ORR report outlines events
described in the incident on 1/29/24, which is not
consistent with her interview during this
investigation. No staff interviewed, including Staff 3,
identified Staff 3 as being present during the
incident.
o Staff 4’s interview during this investigation was
consistent with her interview in the ORR report.
However, ORR noted her statements appeared
rehearsed as she could not furnish details regarding
the incident.
o Staff 5 was not interviewed by ORR.
o Supervisor’s interview during this investigation was
somewhat consistent with her interview in the ORR
report, but there weren’t as many details in the ORR
report.
• Supervisor has 3 disciplinary records in her employee file,
unrelated to this investigation. Supervisor was terminated
from employment on 6/11/24 because of the substantiated
ORR report regarding these allegations.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews conducted
and documentation reviewed, there is not enough information to
support a violation.
Staff 1 reported she saw Supervisor use a blocking pad to push
Youth A to keep him from exiting his room. Staff 1 reported the
incident occurred in December 2023 or January 2024. Youth A did
not arrive at the facility until 1/23/24, and according to the staff
schedule, Staff 1 did not work with Supervisor from 1/23/24-
6

1/31/24. In addition, Staff 1 could not remember which other staff
were working, so no additional staff could be interviewed about
the alleged incident. Supervisor reported she had no recollection
of this incident and never used a blocking pad to push Youth A to
keep him in his room.
Staff 2 reported she saw Supervisor use a blocking pad to push
Youth A into his bedroom. Staff 4 reported she didn’t remember
seeing Supervisor pick up a blocking pad. Staff 5 reported she
saw Supervisor use a blocking pad to block objects Youth A was
throwing, but never saw Supervisor use a blocking pad to push
Youth A into his room. Supervisor denied she ever picked up a
blocking pad or used a blocking pad to push Youth A into his
room.
Staff 3 reported she saw Supervisor use a blocking pad to push
Youth A into the bathroom. Staff 3 reported the incident occurred
during the morning, sometime in January 2024. Youth A arrived at
the facility on 1/23/24. According to the staff schedule, Staff 3 did
not work any morning shifts with Supervisor from 1/23/24-1/31/24.
Staff 3 could not remember which other staff were working, so no
additional staff could be interviewed about the alleged incident.
Supervisor reported she had no recollection of this incident and
never used a blocking pad to push Youth A into the bathroom. In
addition, according to the ORR’s report, Staff 3 did not report the
incident when interviewed on 4/16/24.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Multiple staff failed to follow the agency's reporting policy.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/17/24.
Staff 1 reported she didn’t report Supervisor pushing Youth A
because she was a newer employee and didn’t recognize it was
wrong until after she spoke with Staff 2. Staff 1 reported she didn’t
talk to anyone else about the incident until she spoke to ORR.
Staff 1 reported she knows she’s a mandated reporter, has been
told how to report incidents, and who to report them to. However,
Staff 1 reported she has been provided a lot of information since
7

September 2023 when she started and couldn’t remember the
specific instructions. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 stated she was going
to report the incident, so Staff 1 let her do it instead.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/21/24.
Staff 2 reported she completed a recipient right’s complaint
regarding the incident in early February 2024. Staff 2 reported she
felt nervous about Supervisor retaliating, which is why she didn’t
report the incident to anyone within the facility. Staff 2 reported
she didn’t think anyone else in a management role would take the
concern seriously because Supervisor was a part of the
management team too.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 5/15/24. Staff 3 reported
she didn’t tell anyone about the incident she witnessed because it
didn’t seem wrong at the time since she hadn’t been trained
regarding the use of blocking pads. Staff 3 reported she didn’t
realize it was wrong until after she spoke with Staff 2. Staff 3
reported she knew Staff 2 was making a complaint, so Staff 3
didn’t feel it necessary to make one.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• SIR #2024SIC0001218 (dated 4/17/24) had an identical
allegation, but no findings. Supervisor, Staff 1, Staff 2, and
Staff 3 were not interviewed as part of the investigation.
• Incident and Accident Reporting Procedure states an
incident and accident report form will always be filled out
when an employee witnesses, discovers, or is notified of an
unusual incident, which is any occurrence that disrupts or
adversely affects the course of treatment or care of an
individual served. It also states, “Failure to report abuse
and/or neglect leaves an individual served at risk and
constitutes neglect”.
• No incident or accident report forms were completed for
1/29/24.
• Staff 1 doesn’t have any disciplinary records in her
employee file. Staff 1 was trained on the incident reporting
procedures during orientation in October 2023.
• Staff 2 doesn’t have any disciplinary records in her
employee file. Staff 2 was trained on the incident reporting
procedures during orientation between July-August 2022.
8

• Staff 3 doesn’t have any disciplinary records in her
employee file. Staff 1 was trained on the incident reporting
procedures during orientation between October-November
2023.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per interviews
conducted and documentation reviewed, Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff
3 did not follow the facility’s incident reporting procedure. As a
result, the incidents were not investigated timely, and Supervisor
continued to have access to the facility’s youth.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
June 21, 2024
Shannon (Shay) Mavis Date
